title: Validator cannot connect to beacon on goerli
body:
edit:
this can be marked as solved. all i had to do was add the following flags to my beacon-chain:
--rpc-port=4000
--rpc-host=0.0.0.0

-------------------------------------------------------

im running geth and a beacon chain in a pod in a kubernetes cluster. the sync is done, they are both running and actively importing new blocks

geth logs:

INFO [10-30|15:01:50.037] Chain head was updated                   number=7,861,117 hash=273cae..2c4953 root=5d75cf..56ac83 elapsed=2.387778ms
INFO [10-30|15:01:50.038] Unindexed transactions                   blocks=1 txs=1   tail=5,511,118 elapsed="103.795Âµs"
INFO [10-30|15:02:02.478] Imported new potential chain segment     blocks=1 txs=114 mgas=22.289 elapsed=106.019ms   mgasps=210.238 number=7,861,118 hash=90affe..860bb0 dirty=78.34MiB

beacon logs:

ime="2022-10-30 15:03:07" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=46 inbound=0 outbound=46 prefix=p2p
time="2022-10-30 15:03:37" level=info msg="Synced new block" block=0xa606042d... epoch=131859 finalizedEpoch=131857 finalizedRoot=0x97e7885b... prefix=blockchain slot=4219518
time="2022-10-30 15:03:37" level=info msg="Finished applying state transition" attestations=128 payloadHash=0x7f546b89108a prefix=blockchain slot=4219518 syncBitsCount=429 txCount=124


now, i try to run a validator and im getting this error:

time="2022-10-30 15:06:11" level=warning msg="Could not determine if beacon chain started" error="could not setup beacon chain ChainStart streaming client: rpc error: code = Unavailable desc = connection error: desc = "transport: Error while dialing dial tcp 190.90.11.105:4000: connect: connection refused": could not connect" prefix=validator




im not sure what im doing wrong, i specified to pod ip of the beacon (also tried doing so with container name, aswell as service name, all resulting the same error), ports are opened and services are setup correctly. 
i was able to connect geth with beacon chain on port 8551, so why cant i do the same on port 4000 for a validator, using an identical setup?
